column5: hello all just thought id ask what your favorite ice fishing line is? all that know me know i don't use a rod and reel lol,im still old school and i use a jigging stick   now with that said i love to use 50lb magnathin line   yep you read it right 50lb megnathin line  .  Hawg Hunter
My friends and I are also old-school and use sticks as well! We mainly ice fish for lakers and run 80 lb braid.
I use wooden tipups that I make myself rigged with reels and 40lbs braid Here's a few pics      Leechman
P-line fluoroclear for everything. 2lb for perch all the way up to 12lb for jigging the big fish.  Sinker
Braid, I prefer Power Pro. It does freeze, but no other type if line straightens out better to get maximum feel out of a light bait.
Power pro and and bass pro regular mon. Always use a flouro leader.

I use a 6lbs thor ultra, for lakers and whities on a thorne bros rod with a  2500 stradic.  Ive used all sorts of line and this has produced the best results for me by far.  light enough to let a small williams fall to the bottom in 120fow, and strong enough to handle a big laker.
any line thats 6-8 lbs test, any line.
80lb-50lb-40lb??????? i didnt know you guys were fishing in the ocean!!! when you set the hook on a perch does anything but the lips come up???

For fresh water fish I use 4 to 8 lb test mono if in shallow water or 6 to 10 lb test Fireline in deeper water.  For deep saltwater fishing in the Saguenay River, I use 30 and 40 lb braid and for ocean perch in deep water I use 14 lb test Fireline.  I use spinning and baitcasting reels on short home made rods.
Power pro on the jigging rod (15# diameter, 30#test), and good ol' black dacron on the gad -- which is my willow twig tip-up.
4-6lb ice line on the jigging rods and good old black cord on the tip-up.
same line I use for everything else...6 lb. Ande dark green
Im interested in how you ice fish salt water?

haha oh man at Wal-mart on Friday night i was in the fishing area and saw these 2 foot rods i was like 'hey Natasha its your rod but 10x smaller'' then she said it was for ice fishing so i looked at the tag and it was. I have never seen any ice fishing stuff before haha and was kinda shocked she knew. guess she saw a sign somewhere ..... ...
